company_profile.name: EcoThread
company_profile.description: EcoThread is a direct-to-consumer sustainable fashion brand that makes premium basics from 100% recycled ocean plastic and deadstock fabric. Every piece is designed to last 5+ years, comes with a lifetime repair guarantee, and has a fully transparent supply chain you can trace from ocean cleanup to your closet.

facts.label: Core Material
facts.value: Fabric made from 100% recycled ocean plastic (REPREVE certified)

facts.label: Differentiator
facts.value: Lifetime repair guarantee — send any piece back for free repair forever

facts.label: Market Size
facts.value: Sustainable fashion market projected at $33B by 2027, growing 9.7% CAGR

facts.label: Primary Buyer
facts.value: Eco-conscious millennials (28-38) with household income $75K+ who shop online-first

facts.label: Everlane Gap
facts.value: Everlane faced backlash for greenwashing — customers want verifiable transparency

facts.label: Price Point
facts.value: Premium basics: $45-85 per piece, positioned between fast fashion and luxury

facts.label: Early Traction
facts.value: 3,200 customers, $280K revenue in first 8 months, 42% repeat purchase rate

facts.label: Brand Story
facts.value: Founded by a marine biologist who saw ocean plastic firsthand during research dives

facts.label: Retention Insight
facts.value: Customers who use the supply chain tracker buy 2.3x more than those who don't

icps.name: Eco-Conscious Millennial

psychographics.beliefs: Believes individual purchasing decisions can drive systemic change
psychographics.identity: Conscious consumer who researches before buying
psychographics.fears: Being complicit in environmental destruction through mindless consumption
triggers: closet purge reveals how much was wasted

painPoints: Most 'sustainable' brands are greenwashing — hard to know who to trust
Eco-friendly clothes often look frumpy or feel cheap
Premium sustainable brands are prohibitively expensive ($200+ per piece)
goals: Build a capsule wardrobe of pieces that last years, not months
Feel genuinely good about every purchase — no guilt
Look put-together without supporting exploitative supply chains
objections: How do I know your sustainability claims are real?
$65 for a t-shirt is a lot — even if it's sustainable
I've been burned by 'eco' brands before

icps.name: Corporate Sustainability Buyer

demographics.role: Head of People / Office Manager / CSR Lead

psychographics.beliefs: Corporate gifting and merch should reflect company values
psychographics.identity: The person who makes the company walk its sustainability talk
psychographics.fears: Ordering branded merch that ends up in landfill and embarrasses the company
triggers: annual company merch order coming up

painPoints: Corporate merch is universally terrible — cheap, wasteful, unworn
Hard to find suppliers that can prove sustainability claims for ESG reports
Minimum order quantities from sustainable brands are too high for small orders
goals: Source branded basics that employees actually want to wear
Get verifiable sustainability data for ESG reporting
Low MOQ options for team gifts and onboarding kits
objections: Can you do custom branding on sustainable materials?
What's the lead time for corporate orders?
Do you have certifications we can reference in our ESG report?

positioning.uvp: EcoThread makes premium basics from recycled ocean plastic with a lifetime repair guarantee and fully traceable supply chain — so you can see exactly where your clothes come from and know they'll last.
differentiators: 100% recycled ocean plastic fabric (REPREVE certified) — not just 'recycled content'
Lifetime repair guarantee — free repairs forever, no questions asked
Supply chain tracker — trace every piece from ocean cleanup to your closet
Founded by a marine biologist — authenticity you can't fake

competitors.name: Everlane
weaknesses: Opaque supply chain despite 'radical transparency' claim

messaging.oneLiner: EcoThread: Premium basics made from ocean plastic. Built to last. Traced to source.
messaging.positioningStatement: For eco-conscious consumers who are tired of greenwashing and disposable fashion, EcoThread is the sustainable basics brand that uses 100% recycled ocean plastic, offers a lifetime repair guarantee, and lets you trace every piece from ocean cleanup to your closet — unlike Everlane or fast fashion brands that make sustainability claims they can't prove.

valueProps.title: Ocean-to-Closet Traceability
valueProps.description: Every piece comes with a unique supply chain tracker showing its journey from ocean plastic collection to your door.

valueProps.title: Lifetime Repair Guarantee
valueProps.description: Send any piece back for free repair, forever. We believe in making clothes that last, not replacing them.

valueProps.title: Premium Without the Premium Guilt
valueProps.description: Priced between fast fashion and luxury ($45-85), so doing the right thing doesn't require a trust fund.

doList: Share real supply chain data and impact numbers
Tell the founder's marine biology story
Show the product in everyday settings — not just styled shoots
dontList: Don't shame people for past purchases
Don't use guilt as a marketing tactic
Don't make claims without data to back them up

soundbites: Your t-shirt used to be a bottle in the Pacific.
We don't do 'sustainable-ish.' We do traceable.
The best wardrobe is the one you never have to replace.
guardrails: Never shame consumers — inspire them instead
Always cite specific certifications (REPREVE, OEKO-TEX) not vague 'eco-friendly'
Founder story is a strength — use it but don't overdo it
